title: How many octaves can a viola play? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s not so much how many octaves, etc. It’s more of a range thing. Tuning is specific to strings; we do not adjust open string tunings as guitarists do [i.e. - there’s no ‘drop D’ or ‘Open A’ or ‘Ostrich tuning’ in string playing] Viola notes ranges from C, the lowest open string, to A, way up on the A string. [This varies according to how high a player’s fingers can reach and still sound good.] Viola can be played within a 4 octave range and even higher notes can be played as fingered harmonics.
